pullRequest.body:
This PR introduces propositional type classes for the existence of left Kan extensions/lifts, mimicking `HasColimit` instance in the category theory library.

---

(that is, before the `---`) using the following format:

Any other comments you want to keep out of the PR commit should go
below the `---`, and placed outside this HTML comment, or else they
will be invisible to reviewers.

using the following format:

- [ ] depends on: #xyz [optional extra text]

`+ instance : HasLeftKanLift f (h ≫ g) := (LanLift.CommuteWith.isKan f g h).hasLeftKanLift`
`+ instance [HasAbsLeftKanExtension f g] {x : B} (h : c ⟶ x) : Lan.CommuteWith f g h`

`+ instance [HasLeftKanExtension f g] : HasInitial <| LeftExtension f g`
`+ instance [HasLeftKanLift f g] : HasInitial <| LeftLift f g := HasLeftKanLift.hasInitial`
`+ instance {f : a ⟶ b} {g : a ⟶ c} {x : B} {h : c ⟶ x} [IsLeftAdjoint h] [HasLeftKanExtension f g] :`

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9812159534/job/27095692380)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/9812159534/job/27095692179)
Are these notions for the left and right adjoint standard in the literature?
Regarding this, it doesn't seem that this is used anywhere else. It might be better to just write it as `right|Adjoint f`.

```suggestion
@[simps!]
def leftIso {X Y : Comma L₁ R₁} (α : X ≅ Y) : X.left ≅ Y.left := (fst L₁ R₁).mapIso α
```

```suggestion
@[simps!]
def rightIso {X Y : Comma L₁ R₁} (α : X ≅ Y) : X.right ≅ Y.right := (snd L₁ R₁).mapIso α
```
Again, is this a standard notation? (If so, could you add a reference to the literature in `docs/references.bib` and add it to the docstring of the file.)

This notation is used in Kashiwara-Schapira, and I've added the references in the header docs. Although it is not very widely used I guess, I think it is an intuitive and convenient notation that's worth using.

We may prefer this syntax:
```suggestion
  commute {x : B} (h : c ⟶ x) : Lan.CommuteWith f g h
```

In the API for `Lan.CommuteWith`, I think that the lemmas should be stated not only for the chosen `lanLeftExtension f g`, but all for any left extension which satisfies `IsKan`. In particular, I think that the `Lan.CommuteWith.isKan` definition should be generalized as `LeftExtension.IsKan.whiskerOfCommute`.

@joelriou Sorry for the late reply. 

I may not understand the point yet. Could you explain in a little more detail your idea about `LeftExtension.IsKan.whiskerOfCommute`?

In addition to `isKan`, we would have:
```lean
def _root_.CategoryTheory.Bicategory.LeftExtension.IsKan.whiskerOfCommute
    {f : a ⟶ b} {g : a ⟶ c} {t : LeftExtension f g} (ht : t.IsKan) {x : B} (h : c ⟶ x)
    [HasLeftKanExtension f g] [Lan.CommuteWith f g h] :
    (t.whisker h).IsKan := by
  sorry
```
Of course, `t` must be isomorphic to `lanLeftExtension`, so that this is true.

Basically, any definition/lemma where `lanLeftExtension` appears should have a version which applies to any left extension `t` which satisfies `t.IsKan`.

Then, I also think that it would be better if `CommuteWith` was like:
```lean
class Lan.CommuteWith (f : a ⟶ b) (g : a ⟶ c) {x : B} (h : c ⟶ x) : Prop :=
  hasLeftKanExtension : HasLeftKanExtension f g := by infer_instance
  commute : Nonempty <| IsKan <| (lanLeftExtension f g).whisker h
```
Also, we should have a constructor for `CommuteWith` which takes as input a `t` as above such that `t.IsKan` and `(t.whisker h).IsKan`.
@joelriou Thank you for your explanation. I have added lemmas. My feeling is that these are problems of transporting `IsKan` along an isomorphism.
Here, I think it would be better if instead of an iso, the assumption was `t.IsUniversal`.

```suggestion
/-- A structure giving a chosen right adjoint of a 1-morphism `left`. -/
```

```suggestion
/-- A structure giving a chosen left adjoint of a 1-morphism `right`. -/
```

In order to have similar names in category theory and bicategory theory, I would suggest:
```suggestion
def Adjunction.ofIsLeftAdjoint (f : a ⟶ b) [IsLeftAdjoint f] : f ⊣ rightAdjoint f :=
```
Same for the other side.

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat(CategoryTheory/Bicategory): existence of Kan extensions
